criterion: Reward for documenting every clinically relevant statement explicitly or implicitly made in the transcript, including medication tolerance (losartan without cough, atorvastatin without myalgias), home blood-pressure trend, and travel refill advice, with no omissions.

Reward for accurately recording current medications and dosages exactly as listed in the chart (Losartan 50 mg tablet, Atorvastatin 10 mg tablet) when referenced, without altering strength, formulation, or spelling.
Reward for concisely importing only chart elements directly relevant to the visit (patient age/sex, diagnoses of hypertension and hyperlipidemia) while leaving out unrelated chart data.
Penalize for omitting the clinician’s instruction to continue home blood-pressure monitoring and to notify the clinic if readings consistently change.
Penalize for failing to capture the clinician’s travel-related refill advice or misrepresenting its wording or intent.
Penalize for introducing information not present in either the transcript or chart (e.g., new symptoms, exams, labs, diagnoses, or plans) or for speculating on clinical reasoning.
Penalize for copying irrelevant chart details (e.g., family history, unused Canvas context instructions) or for selective chart copying that creates misleading emphasis.
Penalize for inaccuracies in names, doses, durations, or instructions of medications mentioned, or for misattributing statements to the wrong speaker.
